content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────
No new structures have been successfully constructed on the map during these steps. Multiple attempts were made to supply a Lab for Automation Science Pack research—including efforts to locate, craft, and place the Lab at Position(x=0.5, y=2.5)—but none succeeded due to inventory shortages and crafting dependencies. In addition, retrieval actions have identified existing furnace entities (one at Position(x=5.0, y=5.0) used for smelting iron plates and another at Position(x=-27.0, y=-60.0) used for copper plate production); however, these were referenced as part of resource processing and not as newly built structures. The current map state remains without any successfully placed structures.

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• API Parameter Handling and Return Validation
  - When calling functions such as get_entities, use the correct parameters as defined by its signature. Avoid passing unsupported keyword arguments (e.g. “radius”) or an incorrect number of positional arguments.
  - Before iterating over the result of an API call, confirm that the returned value is iterable to prevent errors like attempting to iterate over a None value.

• Placement and Inventory Checks
  - Verify that the required item (e.g. a Lab) is present in the inventory before attempting to place it on the map.
  - Ensure that placement conditions are met and that the target tile is free and valid prior to placement actions.

• Crafting Dependency and Resource Management
  - Confirm that all sub-ingredients required for complex items (such as labs) are available or producible. Errors indicated missing items in the production chains for iron-gear-wheels, electronic circuits, and copper cables.
  - Monitor resource counts and production capabilities (e.g. sufficient iron-plate and copper-plate production via furnaces) to satisfy the cascading ingredient requirements for crafting higher-level components.
